data.name: Arctic Wolves
data.oracle_text:
Cumulative upkeep {2} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
When Arctic Wolves enters the battlefield, draw a card.
data.flavor_text: "No matter where we cat warriors go in the world, those stupid slobberers find us." —Mirri of the Weatherlight

data.name: Arlinn's Wolf
data.oracle_text: Arlinn's Wolf can't be blocked by creatures with power 2 or less.
data.flavor_text:
"If you don't speak wolf, allow me to translate: 'One step closer and I'll rip out your throat.'"
—Arlinn Kord

data.name: Assembled Alphas
data.oracle_text: Whenever Assembled Alphas blocks or becomes blocked by a creature, Assembled Alphas deals 3 damage to that creature and 3 damage to that creature's controller.
data.flavor_text: There is always a toll to pay for passage.

data.name: Brazen Wolves
data.oracle_text: Whenever Brazen Wolves attacks, it gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: With fewer patrols about, Kessig's roads have become prime hunting grounds.

data.name: Briarpack Alpha
data.oracle_text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Briarpack Alpha enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: "One of my greatest teachers." —Garruk Wildspeaker

data.name: Carrion Howler
data.oracle_text: Pay 1 life: Carrion Howler gets +2/-1 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: They chase tirelessly after the bone-carts that speed along the streets of the Plague Quarter.

data.name: Darkthicket Wolf
data.oracle_text: {2}{G}: Darkthicket Wolf gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
data.flavor_text: Werewolf slayers don't know for certain how werewolves are created. So they kill all the wolves, just to be safe.

data.name: Deranged Whelp
data.oracle_text: Menace (This creature can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
data.flavor_text:
"When you confront a wolf scorned by its pack, extra caution is the order of the day."
—Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

data.name: Dire Wolves
data.oracle_text: Dire Wolves has banding as long as you control a Plains. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
data.flavor_text: "It's amazing how scared a city kid can get at a dog. Now, of course, I'd cross Terisiare alone, and keep no watch if I had a pack of greys hanging on my flanks as I went." —Oddveig Ulfsson, caravan scout

data.name: Ember-Eye Wolf
data.oracle_text:
Haste
{1}{R}: Ember-Eye Wolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: No howl. No snarl. Just the roar of flames.

data.name: Fang of the Pack
data.oracle_text:
Melee (Whenever this creature attacks, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each opponent you attacked with a creature this combat.)
At the beginning of combat on your turn, another target creature you control gains melee until end of turn. (If a creature has multiple instances of melee, each triggers separately.)

data.name: Feral Ridgewolf
data.oracle_text:
Trample
{1}{R}: Feral Ridgewolf gets +2/+0 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: "The wolves no longer hunt just to feed. They kill for sport, or for some madness behind their eyes." —Elmut, crossway watcher

data.name: Ferocious Pup
data.oracle_text: When Ferocious Pup enters the battlefield, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
data.flavor_text: The strongest pack has the fiercest pups.

data.name: Fierce Witchstalker
data.oracle_text:
Trample
When Fierce Witchstalker enters the battlefield, create a Food token. (It's an artifact with "{2}, {T}, Sacrifice this artifact: You gain 3 life.")
data.flavor_text: When the realm has laws, in the wilds there are other ways of balancing power.

data.name: Heart Wolf
data.oracle_text:
First strike
{T}: Target Dwarf creature gets +2/+0 and gains first strike until end of turn. When that creature leaves the battlefield this turn, sacrifice Heart Wolf. Activate this ability only during combat.

data.name: Howlgeist
data.oracle_text:
Creatures with power less than Howlgeist's power can't block it.
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

data.name: Howling Wolf
data.oracle_text: When Howling Wolf enters the battlefield, you may search your library for up to three cards named Howling Wolf, reveal them, and put them into your hand. If you do, shuffle your library.

data.name: Howlpack Wolf
data.oracle_text: Howlpack Wolf can't block unless you control another Wolf or Werewolf.
data.flavor_text: Wolves and werewolves join together for the common cause of the hunt.

data.name: Immerwolf
data.oracle_text:
Intimidate (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or creatures that share a color with it.)
Each other creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf gets +1/+1.
Non-Human Werewolves you control can't transform.

data.name: Kessig Wolf
data.oracle_text: {1}{R}: Kessig Wolf gains first strike until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: "Don't be afraid when you hear the wolves howl. Be afraid when you don't hear them at all." —Saint Trogen, the Slayer

data.name: Lone Wolf
data.oracle_text: You may have Lone Wolf assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.
data.flavor_text: A wolf without a pack is either a survivor or a brute.

data.name: Lupine Prototype
data.oracle_text: Lupine Prototype can't attack or block unless a player has no cards in hand.
data.flavor_text:
"Ludevic saw it in a dream and set to work immediately, every detail already known. Can such genius be taught?"
—Stitcher Geralf

data.name: Nightpack Ambusher
data.oracle_text:
Flash
Other Wolves and Werewolves you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of your end step, if you didn't cast a spell this turn, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
data.flavor_text: A strong leader means a growing pack.

data.name: Nyxborn Wolf
data.oracle_text:
Bestow {4}{G} (If you cast this card for its bestow cost, it's an Aura spell with enchant creature. It becomes a creature again if it's not attached to a creature.)
Enchanted creature gets +3/+1.

data.name: Pack Guardian
data.oracle_text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
When Pack Guardian enters the battlefield, you may discard a land card. If you do, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.

data.name: Pyreheart Wolf
data.oracle_text:
Whenever Pyreheart Wolf attacks, creatures you control gain menace until end of turn. (They can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.)
Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)

data.name: Quilled Wolf
data.oracle_text: {5}{G}: Quilled Wolf gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: "I know a ranger that thought to make a cloak of its hide. He ended up losing an eye for his trouble." —Raf Gyel of the Quiver of Kessig

data.name: Rot Wolf
data.oracle_text:
Infect (This creature deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters and to players in the form of poison counters.)
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Rot Wolf this turn dies, you may draw a card.
data.set_name: Duel Decks: Mirrodin Pure vs. New Phyrexia

data.name: Russet Wolves
data.flavor_text: "The wolves of our valley are bred to detest the scent of ghouls. For centuries they have kept our estates clear of such carrion." —Olivia Voldaren

data.name: Sacred Wolf
data.oracle_text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
data.flavor_text: "I raised my bow, and the wolf stared at me. Under its gaze, my finger would not release the string." —Aref the Hunter

data.name: Scourge Wolf
data.oracle_text:
First strike
Delirium — Scourge Wolf has double strike as long as there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.

data.name: Silverfur Partisan
data.oracle_text:
Trample
Whenever a Wolf or Werewolf you control becomes the target of an instant or sorcery spell, create a 2/2 green Wolf creature token.
data.flavor_text: Silverfurs are the last remaining wolfir.

data.name: Skalla Wolf
data.oracle_text: When Skalla Wolf enters the battlefield, look at the top five cards of your library. You may reveal a green card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
data.flavor_text:
"This imprint was the familiar of a friend."
—Vivien Reid

data.name: Somberwald Alpha
data.oracle_text:
Whenever a creature you control becomes blocked, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
{1}{G}: Target creature you control gains trample until end of turn. (It can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)

data.name: Spirit of the Hunt
data.oracle_text:
Flash
When Spirit of the Hunt enters the battlefield, each other creature you control that's a Wolf or a Werewolf gets +0/+3 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: The bonds of the pack transcend time and death.

data.name: Tel-Jilad Wolf
data.oracle_text: Whenever Tel-Jilad Wolf becomes blocked by an artifact creature, Tel-Jilad Wolf gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: Thanks to the wolves, Tel-Jilad is the one area of Mirrodin the myr don't see often.

data.name: Thornhide Wolves
data.flavor_text:
"Halana grew brambles to create a barricade around our camp, hoping that it would keep the wolves out. That was a mistake for which we almost paid dearly."
—Alena, trapper of Kessig

data.name: Timberpack Wolf
data.oracle_text: Timberpack Wolf gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control named Timberpack Wolf.
data.flavor_text: "The need for the pack is bred in their bones. Their true strength will not show itself for any other purpose." —Garruk Wildspeaker

data.name: Timber Wolves
data.oracle_text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
data.flavor_text: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

data.name: Tundra Wolves
data.oracle_text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
data.flavor_text: "I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains." —Onean scout

data.name: Ulrich's Kindred
data.oracle_text:
Trample
{3}{G}: Target attacking Wolf or Werewolf gains indestructible until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: "I am not its master. We are of the same pack." —Ulrich, Krallenhorde alpha

data.name: Wandering Wolf
data.oracle_text: Creatures with power less than Wandering Wolf's power can't block it.
data.flavor_text: Humans still feared wolves, though no connection between them and the curse of lycanthropy had ever been proved.

data.name: Watchwolf
data.flavor_text: Only in Ravnica do the wolves watch the flock.

data.name: Wicked Wolf
data.oracle_text:
When Wicked Wolf enters the battlefield, it fights up to one target creature you don't control.
Sacrifice a Food: Put a +1/+1 counter on Wicked Wolf. It gains indestructible until end of turn. Tap it.

data.name: Witchstalker
data.oracle_text:
Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
Whenever an opponent casts a blue or black spell during your turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Witchstalker.

data.name: Wolfir Avenger
data.oracle_text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
{1}{G}: Regenerate Wolfir Avenger.
data.flavor_text: Released from a dark curse and bound to a higher calling.

data.name: Wolfir Silverheart
data.oracle_text:
Soulbond (You may pair this creature with another unpaired creature when either enters the battlefield. They remain paired for as long as you control both of them.)
As long as Wolfir Silverheart is paired with another creature, each of those creatures gets +4/+4.

data.name: Wolf of Devil's Breach
data.oracle_text: Whenever Wolf of Devil's Breach attacks, you may pay {1}{R} and discard a card. If you do, Wolf of Devil's Breach deals damage to target creature or planeswalker equal to the discarded card's converted mana cost.
data.flavor_text: "How can werewolves be considered abominations next to such creatures?" —Arlinn Kord

data.name: Wolf Pack
data.oracle_text: You may have Wolf Pack assign its combat damage as though it weren't blocked.

data.name: Wyluli Wolf
data.oracle_text: {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
data.flavor_text: "When one wolf calls, others follow. Who wants to fight creatures that eat scorpions?" —Maimun al-Wyluli, diary

data.name: Young Wolf
data.oracle_text: Undying (When this creature dies, if it had no +1/+1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a +1/+1 counter on it.)
data.flavor_text: The Ulvenwald makes no allowances for youth. Today's newborn is either tomorrow's hunter or tomorrow's lunch.
